resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

pitrou commented on pull request #4313: ARROW-5102: [C++] Reduce header dependencies
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4313
 
 
   This is a first attempt at making our headers lighter-weight.
   
   The benefits are currently meagre: I get a 4% speedup when compiling Arrow + Parquet.

 @@ -32,19 +32,40 @@
 flight = pytest.importorskip("pyarrow.flight")
 
 
+def simple_ints_table():
+    data = [
+        pa.array([-10, -5, 0, 5, 10])
+    ]
+    return pa.Table.from_arrays(data, names=['some_ints'])
+
+
+def simple_dicts_table():
+    dict_values = pa.array(["foo", "baz", "quux"], type=pa.utf8())
+    data = [
+        pa.chunked_array([
+            pa.DictionaryArray.from_arrays([1, 0, None], dict_values),
+            pa.DictionaryArray.from_arrays([2, 1], dict_values)]),
+    ]
+    return pa.Table.from_arrays(data, names=['some_dicts'])
+
+

fields.description:
To tame C++ compile times, we should try to reduce the number of heavy dependencies in our .h files.

Two possible avenues come to mind:
* avoid including `unordered_map` and friends
* avoid including C++ stream libraries (such as `iostream`, `ios`, `sstream`...)

Unfortunately we're currently including `sstream` in `status.h` for some template APIs. We may move those to a separate include file (e.g. `status-builder.h`).

comments.body: "avoid including" means in this case to foward declare and then include in the {{.cc}}?
If possible, otherwise change implementation so that private implementation details don't appear in the header.
I would be in favor of adding a {{StatusBuilder}} API

There are interesting measurements of compile time induced by standard C++ headers here:
http://virtuallyrandom.com/c-compilation-lies-damned-lies-and-statistics/

Also see https://aras-p.info/blog/2019/01/16/time-trace-timeline-flame-chart-profiler-for-Clang/
clang 9.0 will hopefully help us tackle this much more rationally.
